sen.j: 教興寺の戦い（きょうこうじのたたかい）は、永禄5年（1562年）5月19日、20日の両日に、河内国高安郡教興寺村（現在の大阪府八尾市教興寺）付近であった三好長慶と畠山高政との合戦。
sen.e: The Battle of Kyoko-ji Temple was fought between Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Takamasa HATAKEYAMA near Kyoko-ji Mura, Takayasu County, Kawachi Province (present-day Kyoko-ji, Yao City, Osaka Prefecture) on May 19 and 20, 1562.

The Battle of Kyoko-ji Temple was fought between Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Takamasa HATAKEYAMA near Kyoko-ji Mura, Takayasu County, Kawachi Province (present-day Kyoko-ji, Yao City, Osaka Prefecture) on May 19 and 20, 1562.

The Battle of Kyoko-ji Temple was fought between Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Takamasa HATAKEYAMA near Kyoko-ji Mura, Takayasu County, Kawachi Province (present-day Kyoko-ji, Yao City, Osaka Prefecture) on May 19 and 20, 1562.

sen.j: 別名、教興寺合戦。
sen.e: It is also referred to as Kyoko-ji Kassen.
It is also referred to as Kyoko-ji Kassen.
It is also referred to as Kyoko-ji Kassen.

sen.j: 戦国時代_(日本)における畿内での最大の会戦。
sen.e: It was the biggest battle fought during Sengoku period (period of warring states) in Kinai region.
It was the biggest battle fought during Sengoku period (period of warring states) in Kinai region.
It was the biggest battle fought during Sengoku period (period of warring states) in Kinai region.

sen.j: 三好政権と河内畠山氏が、畿内の覇権をめぐって争った一連の戦いの最終章。
sen.e: It was the last battle of the series of battles fought between the Miyoshi's government and the Kawachi Hatakeyama clan, both seeking for supremacy in Kinai region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was the last battle of the series of battles fought between the Miyoshi's government and the Kawachi Hatakeyama clan, both seeking for supremacy in Kinai region.
It was the last battle of the series of battles fought between the Miyoshi's government and the Kawachi Hatakeyama clan, both seeking for supremacy in Kinai region.

sen.j: 三好政権は下克上で細川管領体制を崩壊させた新興勢力であった。
sen.e: The Miyoshi's government was an emergent power which brought down the Hosokawa's Kanrei (top ranked job in Muromachi era to support shogun and control the government) system by a revolt.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Miyoshi's government was an emergent power which brought down the Hosokawa's Kanrei (top ranked job in Muromachi era to support shogun and control the government) system by a revolt.
The Miyoshi's government was an emergent power which brought down the Hosokawa's Kanrei (top ranked job in Muromachi era to support shogun and control the government) system by a revolt.

sen.j: 河内畠山氏は、細川氏と同族であり、同じく室町幕府三管領のひとつであり、長年細川氏と対立してきた旧勢力であった。
sen.e: The Kawachi Hatakeyama clan was an old power, one of Sankanrei (three families in the post of Kanrei) and relatives to the Hosokawa clan, but had been opposed to the Hosokawa clan for long.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kawachi Hatakeyama clan was an old power, one of Sankanrei (three families in the post of Kanrei) and relatives to the Hosokawa clan, but had been opposed to the Hosokawa clan for long.
The Kawachi Hatakeyama clan was an old power, one of Sankanrei (three families in the post of Kanrei) and relatives to the Hosokawa clan, but had been opposed to the Hosokawa clan for long.

sen.j: 新興勢力の智将、三好長慶と旧勢力の勇将、畠山高政指揮による合戦であった。
sen.e: The battle was led by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, a resourceful general of the emerging power, and Takamasa HATAKEYAMA, a brave general of the old power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The battle was led by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, a resourceful general of the emerging power, and Takamasa HATAKEYAMA, a brave general of the old power.
The battle was led by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, a resourceful general of the emerging power, and Takamasa HATAKEYAMA, a brave general of the old power.

sen.j: 互いの勢力の全てを結集して会戦で,三好長慶はこの戦いに勝利することで、畿内の旧勢力の抵抗を排除できた。
sen.e: It was a big battle in which all the brigades were mobilized, and Nagayoshi MIYOSHI successfully got rid of the opposing old powers in Kinai region by winning this battle.
It was a big battle in which all the brigades were mobilized, and Nagayoshi MIYOSHI successfully got rid of the opposing old powers in Kinai region by winning this battle.
It was a big battle in which all the brigades were mobilized, and Nagayoshi MIYOSHI successfully got rid of the opposing old powers in Kinai region by winning this battle.

sen.j: また、河内国、和泉国を勢力下におき、大和国、紀伊国へも勢力を浸透させることに成功したことで三好長慶は天下人となった。
sen.e: Nagayoshi MIYOSHI became Tenkabito (person becoming the ruler of the country), taking control of Kawachi Province and Izumi Province, while becoming influential in Yamato Province and Kii Province.
Nagayoshi MIYOSHI became Tenkabito (person becoming the ruler of the country), taking control of Kawachi Province and Izumi Province, while becoming influential in Yamato Province and Kii Province.
Nagayoshi MIYOSHI became Tenkabito (person becoming the ruler of the country), taking control of Kawachi Province and Izumi Province, while becoming influential in Yamato Province and Kii Province.

sen.j: しかし、この戦いの中で、一族の有力者であった三好政成、三好義賢などを失ったことから三好政権の前途に暗雲が見え隠れするようになった。
sen.e: However he lost Masanari MIYOSHI and Yoshitaka MIYOSHI, who were both influential among his family, in this battle, so the Miyoshi's government had difficulties lying ahead..
However he lost Masanari MIYOSHI and Yoshikata MIYOSHI, who were both influential among his family, in this battle, so the Miyoshi's government had difficulties lying ahead..
However he lost Masanari MIYOSHI and Yoshikata MIYOSHI, who were both influential among his family, in this battle, so the Miyoshi's government had difficulties lying ahead..

sen.j: 河内国の守護として畠山氏は室町時代の初期より君臨してきた。
sen.e: The Hatakeyama clan had reigned as shugo (provincial military governor) of Kawachi Province since the early Muromachi Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Hatakeyama clan had reigned as shugo (provincial military governor) of Kawachi Province since the early Muromachi Period.
The Hatakeyama clan had reigned as shugo (provincial military governor) of Kawachi Province since the early Muromachi Period.

sen.j: だが、隣国摂津国をはじめ、阿波国や淡路国、讃岐国などの守護であった三好長慶によって圧迫されることが多かった。
sen.e: The Hatakeyama clan had been frequently oppressed by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, shugo of the neighboring Settsu Province as well as Awa Province, Awaji Province and Sanuki Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Hatakeyama clan had been frequently oppressed by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, shugo of the neighboring Settsu Province as well as Awa Province, Awaji Province and Sanuki Province.
The Hatakeyama clan had been frequently oppressed by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, shugo of the neighboring Settsu Province as well as Awa Province, Awaji Province and Sanuki Province.

sen.j: また、畠山氏の当主、畠山高政は勇将ではあったが、家中の状況は戦国の風潮があり、家臣団の統制も困難を伴った。
sen.e: Takamasa Hatakeyama, the family head of the Hatakeyama clan, was a brave general, but the Hatakeyama family itself was disrupted by the Sengoku mood shift, so controlling the vassals was difficult.
Takamasa Hatakeyama, the family head of the Hatakeyama clan, was a brave general, but the Hatakeyama family itself was disrupted by the Sengoku mood shift, so controlling the vassals was difficult.
Takamasa Hatakeyama, the family head of the Hatakeyama clan, was a brave general, but the Hatakeyama family itself was disrupted by the Sengoku mood shift, so controlling the vassals was difficult.

sen.j: その結果、隣国の戦国大名である三好長慶によって内政干渉を受けることも多かった。
sen.e: Consequently, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, the warring lord of the neighboring province, often interfered in Hatakeyama's domestic affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, the warring lord of the neighboring province, often interfered in Hatakeyama's domestic affairs.
Consequently, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, the warring lord of the neighboring province, often interfered in Hatakeyama's domestic affairs.

sen.j: 家臣団筆頭である守護代を独自に決定することさえ三好長慶の干渉を受けることがあった。
sen.e: Miyoshi Nagayoshi even affected the choice of shugodai (deputy military governor) which was the head of the vassals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Miyoshi Nagayoshi even affected the choice of shugodai (deputy military governor) which was the head of the vassals.
Miyoshi Nagayoshi even affected the choice of shugodai (deputy military governor) which was the head of the vassals.

sen.j: 1551年5月5日に守護代で、実質的に河内の国主といえた器量人の守護代遊佐長教が暗殺された。
sen.e: On May 5, 1552, Naganori YUSA, who was resourceful shugodai considered as an actual landed daimyo of Kawachi, was assassinated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On May 5, 1551, Naganori YUSA, who was resourceful shugodai considered as an actual landed daimyo of Kawachi, was assassinated.
On May 5, 1551, Naganori YUSA, who was resourceful shugodai considered as an actual landed daimyo of Kawachi, was assassinated.

sen.j: すると河内国は混乱を極めたが、1552年には遊佐長教の一族で、河内国交野市の有力国人の安見氏の養子に入っていた安見宗房（直政）が遊佐長教を暗殺した萱振賢継などを討伐して台頭した。
sen.e: Then Kawachi Province fell into disorder, but in 1552, a relative to Naganori YUSA, Munefusa (Naomasa) YASUMI who was the adopted son of a powerful local lord in Katano City, Kawachi Province, the Yasumi clan, killed the assassinators including 萱振賢継 and gained power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「萱振賢継」の読み方不明。
sen.e: Then Kawachi Province fell into disorder, but in 1552, a relative to Naganori YUSA, Munefusa (Naomasa) YASUMI who was the adopted son of a powerful local lord in Katano City, Kawachi Province, the Yasumi clan, killed the assassinators including Katatsugu KAYAFURI and gained power.
sen.cmt: 萱振賢継の読みは不明です。Katatsugu KAYAFURIとしておきました。
sen.e: Then Kawachi Province fell into disorder, but in 1552, a relative to Naganori YUSA, Munefusa (Naomasa) YASUMI who was the adopted son of a powerful local lord in Katano City, Kawachi Province, the Yasumi clan, killed the assassinators including Katatsugu KAYAFURI and gained power.

sen.j: この安見宗房が守護代となったが、守護の畠山高政と安見宗房が対立する。
sen.e: Munefusa YASUMI became shugodai, but Munefusa YASUMI and shugo Takamasa HATAKEYAMA began to clash.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Munefusa YASUMI became shugodai (the acting Military Governor), but Munefusa YASUMI and shugo Takamasa HATAKEYAMA began to clash.
Munefusa YASUMI became shugodai (the acting Military Governor), but Munefusa YASUMI and shugo Takamasa HATAKEYAMA began to clash.

sen.j: 1559年、畠山高政は有力国人を味方につけた安見宗房に対抗するために、三好長慶の援助を受けて、安見宗房に対抗した。
sen.e: In 1559, Takamasa HATAKEYAMA asked for Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's support to compete with Munefusa YASUMI who had support from powerful local lords.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1559, Takamasa HATAKEYAMA asked for Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's support to compete with Munefusa YASUMI who had support from powerful local lords.
In 1559, Takamasa HATAKEYAMA asked for Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's support to compete with Munefusa YASUMI who had support from powerful local lords.

sen.j: その際に、安見宗房は居城の飯盛山城を三好長慶に攻略され、飯盛山城は三好長慶の居城となった。
sen.e: On this occasion, Munefusa YASUMI's Imoriyama Castle was attacked by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, and the castle became Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's.
On this occasion, Munefusa YASUMI's Imoriyama Castle was attacked by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, and the castle became Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's.
On this occasion, Munefusa YASUMI's Imoriyama Castle was attacked by Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, and the castle became Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's.

sen.j: その後、1560年には畠山高政と安見宗房が和睦したが、それが三好長慶に畠山氏攻撃の口実とされた。
sen.e: In 1560, Takamasa HATAKEYAMA and Munefusa YASUMI were reconciled, but it gave Nagayoshi MIYOSHI an excuse to attack the Hatakeyama clan.
In 1560, Takamasa HATAKEYAMA and Munefusa YASUMI were reconciled, but it gave Nagayoshi MIYOSHI an excuse to attack the Hatakeyama clan.
In 1560, Takamasa HATAKEYAMA and Munefusa YASUMI were reconciled, but it gave Nagayoshi MIYOSHI an excuse to attack the Hatakeyama clan.

sen.j: 畠山高政は国人領主の統制を整え、安見宗房、湯川直光などの有力諸将を纏め上げ、三好長慶に対抗した。
sen.e: Takamasa HATAKEYAMA started to exercise improved discipline among kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lords), and by uniting powerful warlords such as Munefusa YASUMI and Naomitsu YUKAWA, competed with Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.

Takamasa HATAKEYAMA started to exercise improved discipline among kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lords), and united powerful warlords such as Munefusa YASUMI and Naomitsu YUKAWA to compete with Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.
sen.cmt: ・修正少々読みづらく感じましたので、修正しました。
sen.e: Takamasa HATAKEYAMA started to exercise improved discipline among kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lords), and united powerful warlords such as Munefusa YASUMI and Naomitsu YUKAWA to compete with Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 1562年、そこへ六角義賢（承禎）から三好長慶挟撃の軍事同盟の提案がなされた。
sen.e: In 1562, Yoshikata (Shotei) ROKKAKU proposed a military alliance to launch a pincer attack on Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.
In 1562, Yoshikata (Shotei) ROKKAKU proposed a military alliance to launch a pincer attack on Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.
In 1562, Yoshikata (Shotei) ROKKAKU proposed a military alliance to launch a pincer attack on Nagayoshi MIYOSHI.

sen.j: その背後には、室町幕府の権威回復を謀る足利義輝などの思惑もあった。
sen.e: There was a hidden motive by Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA to restore the authority of the Muromachi bakufu.
There was a hidden motive by Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA to restore the authority of the Muromachi bakufu.
There was a hidden motive by Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA to restore the authority of the Muromachi bakufu.

sen.j: 新興勢力の三好氏に対して旧勢力の六角氏・畠山氏が反撃にでたといえる。
sen.e: It can be said that the Rokkaku clan and the Hatakeyama clan, both old powers, started to fight back against the emerging Miyoshi clan.
It can be said that the Rokkaku clan and the Hatakeyama clan, both old powers, started to fight back against the emerging Miyoshi clan.
It can be said that the Rokkaku clan and the Hatakeyama clan, both old powers, started to fight back against the emerging Miyoshi clan.

tit.e: The military strength and the chain of command
The military strength and the chain of command
The military strength and the chain of command

sen.j: 兵力的には久米田の戦いとはことなり、態勢を整えなおした三好方が優勢となった。
sen.e: Unlike the battle of Kumeda, Miyoshi's army which recovered from its off-balanced position, had an advantage.
Unlike the battle of Kumeda, Miyoshi's army which recovered from its off-balanced position, had an advantage.
Unlike the battle of Kumeda, Miyoshi's army which recovered from its off-balanced position, had an advantage.

sen.j: 当初、畠山方が三好長慶の居城の飯盛山城を攻撃した時点では、畠山方の兵力が三好方を圧倒した。
sen.e: When Hatakeyama's army attacked Imoriyama Castle where Nagayoshi MIYOSHI lived, Hatakeyama's military strength overwhelmed Miyoshi's.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Hatakeyama's army attacked Imoriyama Castle where Nagayoshi MIYOSHI lived, Hatakeyama's military strength overwhelmed Miyoshi's.
When Hatakeyama's army attacked Imoriyama Castle where Nagayoshi MIYOSHI lived, Hatakeyama's military strength overwhelmed Miyoshi's.

sen.j: だが、三好義興らが摂津国の国人や丹波の国人に檄を飛ばして終結させた。
sen.e: Yoshitoki MIYOSHI, however, mobilized local lords in Settsu and Tanba Province, issuing a manifesto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。原文の「終結」では意味不明なので「集結」で訳しています。
sen.e: Yoshitoki MIYOSHI, however, mobilized local lords in Settsu and Tanba Province, issuing a manifesto.
Yoshitoki MIYOSHI, however, mobilized local lords in Settsu and Tanba Province, issuing a manifesto.

sen.j: そのため劣勢を挽回し、教興寺で両軍が対陣する時点では逆に三好方が優勢となっていた。
sen.e: As a result, Miyoshi's side rectified its numerical inferiority, and when Hatakeyama and Miyoshi confronted at Kyoko-ji Temple, Miyoshi's side had the upper hand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, Miyoshi's side rectified its numerical inferiority, and when Hatakeyama and Miyoshi confronted at Kyoko-ji Temple, Miyoshi's side had the upper hand.
As a result, Miyoshi's side rectified its numerical inferiority, and when Hatakeyama and Miyoshi confronted at Kyoko-ji Temple, Miyoshi's side had the upper hand.

sen.j: ただし、畠山方に参戦していた雑賀・根来衆の火縄銃4000丁が三好方の脅威であった。
sen.e: Hatakeyama, however, had Saikashu and Negoroshu (group of armed people) with 4000 matchlock guns, which was a menace to Miyoshi.
Hatakeyama, however, had Saikashu and Negoroshu (group of armed people and armed priests in Negoro-ji Temple) with 4000 matchlock guns, which was a menace to Miyoshi.
sen.cmt: ・追加修正and armed priests in Negoro-ji Temple
sen.e: Hatakeyama, however, had Saikashu and Negoroshu (group of armed people and armed priests in Negoro-ji Temple) with 4000 matchlock guns, which was a menace to Miyoshi.

sen.j: 指揮系統
sen.e: The chain of command
The chain of command
The chain of command

sen.j: 指揮系統に関しては三好方が各部隊（各国人衆）の指揮官に一族を配置して、総大将三好長慶の命令が伝わりやすい編成となっていた。
sen.e: Regarding the chain of command, Miyoshi made family members commanders of each unit (made of local clan), so the orders by the supreme commander Nagayoshi MIYOSHI were delivered well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Regarding the chain of command, Miyoshi made family members commanders of each unit (made of local clan), so the orders by the supreme commander Nagayoshi MIYOSHI were delivered well.
Regarding the chain of command, Miyoshi made family members commanders of each unit (made of local clan), so the orders by the supreme commander Nagayoshi MIYOSHI were delivered well.

sen.j: それに対し、畠山方は国人衆の旗頭や独立した国人領主が各自で参加する編成であったために、全体の指揮系統が一元化されていない。
sen.e: Compared to Miyoshi's, Hatakeyama's chain of commando was not unified, as various leaders of local clans and samurai lords joined the force independently.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Compared to Miyoshi's, Hatakeyama's chain of command was not unified, as various leaders of local clans and samurai lords joined the force independently.
Compared to Miyoshi's, Hatakeyama's chain of command was not unified, as various leaders of local clans and samurai lords joined the force independently.

sen.j: 経過をみると、明らかに三好方が先攻し、それに対して畠山方が対応するという図式となっていた。
sen.e: In the course of the battle, Miyoshi obviously topped first and Hatakeyama had to keep pace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the course of the battle, Miyoshi obviously topped first and Hatakeyama had to keep pace.
In the course of the battle, Miyoshi obviously topped first and Hatakeyama had to keep pace.

sen.j: 戦場で指揮系統が一元化されていた三好方は先手を取り、指揮系統が一元化できていなかった畠山方は後手に回ったと思われる。
sen.e: It is considered that Miyoshi, with an unified chain of command, gained the initiative and Hatakeyama, with a disordered chain of command, had to be one step behind.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is considered that Miyoshi, with an unified chain of command, gained the initiative and Hatakeyama, with a disordered chain of command, had to be one step behind.
It is considered that Miyoshi, with an unified chain of command, gained the initiative and Hatakeyama, with a disordered chain of command, had to be one step behind.

sen.j: 三好方
sen.e: Miyoshi's side
Miyoshi's side
Miyoshi's side

sen.j: 三好長慶……総大将として飯盛山城に在城。
sen.e: Nagayoshi MIYOSHI - stayed at Imoriyama Castle as the supreme commander.
Nagayoshi MIYOSHI - stayed at Imoriyama Castle as the supreme commander.
Nagayoshi MIYOSHI - stayed at Imoriyama Castle as the supreme commander.

sen.j: 伊沢大和守……三好長慶の作戦を各部隊に伝達。
sen.e: Izawa Yamato no kami (governor of Yamato Province) - conveyed Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's strategy to each unit.
Izawa Yamato no kami (governor of Yamato Province) - conveyed Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's strategy to each unit.
Izawa Yamato no kami (governor of Yamato Province) - conveyed Nagayoshi MIYOSHI's strategy to each unit.

sen.j: 長慶の老臣。
sen.e: Nagayoshi's key retainer.
Nagayoshi's key retainer.
Nagayoshi's key retainer.

sen.j: 三好義興……前線総大将として出陣。
sen.e: Yoshitoki MIYOSHI - went to the front as the front-line supreme commander.
Yoshioki MIYOSHI - went to the front as the front-line supreme commander.
Yoshioki MIYOSHI - went to the front as the front-line supreme commander.

sen.j: 長慶の嫡子。
sen.e: Nagayoshi's legitimate child.
Nagayoshi's legitimate child.
Nagayoshi's legitimate child.

sen.j: 松永久秀……前線副将・三好義興を補佐。
sen.e: Hisahide MATSUNAGA - assisted Yoshitoki MIYOSHI as the front-line adjutant general.
sen.cmt: 前後より原文「・」を「前線副将として」と解釈しています
sen.e: Hisahide MATSUNAGA - assisted Yoshioki MIYOSHI as the front-line adjutant general.
Hisahide MATSUNAGA - assisted Yoshioki MIYOSHI as the front-line adjutant general.

sen.j: 三好政康……摂津国人衆を指揮。
sen.e: Masayasu MIYOSHI - led kokujin-shu (powerful families in a province) from Settsu Province.
Masayasu MIYOSHI - led kokujin-shu (powerful families in a province) from Settsu Province.
Masayasu MIYOSHI - led kokujin-shu (powerful families in a province) from Settsu Province.

sen.j: 長慶の一門衆。
sen.e: Nagayoshi's clansman.
Nagayoshi's clansman.
Nagayoshi's clansman.

sen.j: 三好長逸……三好政康を補佐。
sen.e: Nagayuki MIYOSHI - assisted Masayasu MIYOSHI.
Nagayuki MIYOSHI - assisted Masayasu MIYOSHI.
Nagayuki MIYOSHI - assisted Masayasu MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 池田長正……摂津国人衆の旗頭。
sen.e: Nagamasa IKEDA - leader of kokujin-shu from Settsu Province.
Nagamasa IKEDA - leader of kokujin-shu from Settsu Province.
Nagamasa IKEDA - leader of kokujin-shu from Settsu Province.

sen.j: 三好政長の婿。
sen.e: Masanaga MIYOSHI's son-in-law.
Masanaga MIYOSHI's son-in-law.
Masanaga MIYOSHI's son-in-law.

sen.j: 伊丹親興……摂津国人衆の旗頭。
sen.e: Chikatoki ITAMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Settsu Province.
Chikaoki ITAMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Settsu Province.
Chikaoki ITAMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Settsu Province.

sen.j: 三好康長……阿波国人衆を臨時で指揮。
sen.e: Yasunaga MIYOSHI - temporarily led kokujin-shu from Awa Province.
Yasunaga MIYOSHI - temporarily led kokujin-shu from Awa Province.
Yasunaga MIYOSHI - temporarily led kokujin-shu from Awa Province.

sen.j: 長慶の叔父。
sen.e: Nagayoshi's uncle.
Nagayoshi's uncle.
Nagayoshi's uncle.

sen.j: 篠原長房……故三好義賢を補佐、臨時で三好康長を補佐。
sen.e: Nagafusa SHINOHARA - assisted the late Yoshitaka MIYOSHI and temporarily assisted Yasunaga MIYOSHI.
Nagafusa SHINOHARA - assisted the late Yoshikata MIYOSHI and temporarily assisted Yasunaga MIYOSHI.
Nagafusa SHINOHARA - assisted the late Yoshikata MIYOSHI and temporarily assisted Yasunaga MIYOSHI.

sen.j: 十河存保……讃岐国人衆を指揮。
sen.e: Masayasu SOGO - led kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.
Masayasu SOGO - led kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.
Masayasu SOGO - led kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 三好義賢の子。
sen.e: Yoshitaka MIYOSHI's child.
Yoshikata MIYOSHI's child.
Yoshikata MIYOSHI's child.

sen.j: 長慶の甥。
sen.e: Nagayoshi's nephew.
Nagayoshi's nephew.
Nagayoshi's nephew.

sen.j: 香西元載……十河存保を補佐。
sen.e: 元載 KOZAI - assisted Masayasu SOGO.
Motonori KOZAI - assisted Masayasu SOGO.
sen.cmt: ・訂正元載→Motonori元載の読みについて調査しましたが、元載/Motonoriとするものを１件のみ確認しましたのでそのように訳しております。
sen.e: Motonori KOZAI - assisted Masayasu SOGO.

sen.j: 寒川元政……讃岐国人衆の旗頭
sen.e: Motomasa SANGAWA - leader of kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.
Motomasa SANGAWA - leader of kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.
Motomasa SANGAWA - leader of kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 安富盛方……讃岐国人衆の旗頭
sen.e: 盛方 YASUTOMI leader of kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.
Morikata YASUTOMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.
sen.cmt: ・訂正安富盛方の読みについて調査したところ、「安富盛方/Morikata YASUTOMI」でした。「 -」を追加しました。
sen.e: Morikata YASUTOMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 岩成友通……山城国人衆を指揮。
sen.e: Tomomichi IWANARI - led kokujin-shu from Yamashiro Province.
Tomomichi IWANARI - led kokujin-shu from Yamashiro Province.
Tomomichi IWANARI - led kokujin-shu from Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 長慶の婿。
sen.e: Nagayoshi's son-in-law.
Nagayoshi's son-in-law.
Nagayoshi's son-in-law.

sen.j: 安宅冬康……前線で譜代・旗本衆と淡路国人衆を指揮。
sen.e: Fuyuyasu ATAGI - led fudai (hereditary vassals) and hatamoto unit as well as kokujin-shu from Awaji Province at the battlefront.
Fuyuyasu ATAGI - led fudai (hereditary vassals) and hatamoto unit as well as kokujin-shu from Awaji Province at the battlefront.
Fuyuyasu ATAGI - led fudai (hereditary vassals) and hatamoto unit as well as kokujin-shu from Awaji Province at the battlefront.

sen.j: 長慶の弟。
sen.e: Nagayoshi's younger brother.
Nagayoshi's younger brother.
Nagayoshi's younger brother.

sen.j: 松山新介……前線で譜代・旗本衆を指揮し、安宅冬康を補佐。
sen.e: Shinsuke MATSUYAMA - led fudai and hatamoto unit at the battlefront, assisting Fuyuyasu ATAGI.
Shinsuke MATSUYAMA - led fudai and hatamoto unit at the battlefront, assisting Fuyuyasu ATAGI.
Shinsuke MATSUYAMA - led fudai and hatamoto unit at the battlefront, assisting Fuyuyasu ATAGI.

sen.j: 内藤宗勝……丹波国人衆を指揮。
sen.e: Munekatsu NAITO - led kokujin-shu from Tanba Province.
Munekatsu NAITO - led kokujin-shu from Tanba Province.
Munekatsu NAITO - led kokujin-shu from Tanba Province.

sen.j: 前名は松永長頼。
sen.e: Previously called Nagayori MATSUNAGA.
Previously called Nagayori MATSUNAGA.
Previously called Nagayori MATSUNAGA.

sen.j: 松永久秀の弟。
sen.e: Hisahide MATSUNAGA's younger brother.
Hisahide MATSUNAGA's younger brother.
Hisahide MATSUNAGA's younger brother.

sen.j: 畠山方
sen.e: Hatakeyama's side
Hatakeyama's side
Hatakeyama's side

sen.j: 畠山高政……総大将として出陣。
sen.e: Takamasa HATAKEYAMA - went to the front as the supreme commander.
Takamasa HATAKEYAMA - went to the front as the supreme commander.
Takamasa HATAKEYAMA - went to the front as the supreme commander.

sen.j: 河内・紀伊の守護。
sen.e: Shugo of Kawachi Province and Kii Province.
Shugo of Kawachi Province and Kii Province.
Shugo of Kawachi Province and Kii Province.

sen.j: 湯川直光……湯川衆・紀州国人衆を指揮。
sen.e: Naomitsu YUKAWA - led Yukawashu and kokujin-shu from Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Naomitsu YUKAWA - led Yukawashu and kokujin-shu from Kii Province.
Naomitsu YUKAWA - led Yukawashu and kokujin-shu from Kii Province.

sen.j: 河内守護代。
sen.e: Shugodai of Kawachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shugodai of Kawachi.
Shugodai of Kawachi.

sen.j: 遊佐高清……譜代・旗本衆を指揮。
sen.e: Takakiyo YUSA - led fudai and hatamoto unit.
Takakiyo YUSA - led fudai and hatamoto unit.
Takakiyo YUSA - led fudai and hatamoto unit.

sen.j: 元守護代の故遊佐長教の一族。
sen.e: The late shugodai, Naganori YUSA's relative.
The late shugodai, Naganori YUSA's relative.
The late shugodai, Naganori YUSA's relative.

sen.j: 斎藤盛清……遊佐高清を補佐。
sen.e: Morikiyo SAITO - assisted Takakiyo YUSA.
Morikiyo SAITO - assisted Takakiyo YUSA.
Morikiyo SAITO - assisted Takakiyo YUSA.

sen.j: 安見宗房……河内国人衆の旗頭でこれを指揮。
sen.e: Munefusa YASUMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Kawachi Province.
sen.cmt: 訳語が重複するため「でこれを指揮」を訳出していません
sen.e: Munefusa YASUMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Kawachi Province.
Munefusa YASUMI - leader of kokujin-shu from Kawachi Province.

sen.j: 土橋種興……雑賀・根来衆・和泉国人衆を指揮。
sen.e: 土橋種興 - led Saikashu, Negoroshu and kokujin-shu from Izumi Province.
土橋種興 - led Saikashu, Negoroshu and kokujin-shu from Izumi Province.
土橋種興 - led Saikashu, Negoroshu and kokujin-shu from Izumi Province.

sen.j: 鈴木重興……雑賀衆の旗頭。
sen.e: 鈴木重興 - leader of Saikashu.
鈴木重興 - leader of Saikashu.
鈴木重興 - leader of Saikashu.

sen.j: 土橋種興を補佐。
sen.e: Assisted 土橋種興.
Assisted 土橋種興.
Assisted 土橋種興.

sen.j: 津田算正……根来衆の旗頭。
sen.e: Kazumasa TSUDA - leader of Negoroshu.
Kazumasa TSUDA - leader of Negoroshu.
Kazumasa TSUDA - leader of Negoroshu.

sen.j: 土橋種興を補佐。
sen.e: Assisted 土橋種興.
Assisted 土橋種興.
Assisted 土橋種興.

sen.j: 筒井順政……大和国人衆の旗頭でこれを指揮。
sen.e: Junsei TSUTSUI - leader of kokujin-shu from Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 訳語が重複するため「でこれを指揮」を訳出していません
sen.e: Junsei TSUTSUI - leader of kokujin-shu from Yamato Province.
Junsei TSUTSUI - leader of kokujin-shu from Yamato Province.

sen.j: 澤房満……宇陀三将の一人。
sen.e: 澤房満 - one of the three generals in Uda.
澤房満 - one of the three generals in Uda.
澤房満 - one of the three generals in Uda.

sen.j: 秋山教家……宇陀三将の一人。
sen.e: Noriie AKIYAMA - one of the three generals in Uda.
Noriie AKIYAMA - one of the three generals in Uda.
Noriie AKIYAMA - one of the three generals in Uda.

sen.j: 芳野民部大輔……宇陀三将の一人。
sen.e: Yoshino Minbu-taifu (senior ministerial assistant of popular affairs) - one of the three generals in Uda.
Yoshino Minbu-taifu (senior ministerial assistant of popular affairs) - one of the three generals in Uda.
Yoshino Minbu-taifu (senior ministerial assistant of popular affairs) - one of the three generals in Uda.

sen.j: 当日の天候は前日夜半より驟雨であったとの史料がある。
sen.e: There are historical materials saying that they had periodic showers which started in the night of May 18.
There are historical materials saying that they had periodic showers which started in the night of May 18.
There are historical materials saying that they had periodic showers which started in the night of May 18.

sen.j: 三好方は久米田の戦いで雑賀衆および根来衆の鉄砲で三好義賢を失ったことから、雨を待っていたと伝わる。
sen.e: It is said that Miyoshi's army was waiting for the rain because Yoshitaka MIYOSHI was shot by Saikashu or Negoroshu in the battle of Kumeda.
It is said that Miyoshi's army was waiting for the rain because Yoshitaka MIYOSHI was shot by Saikashu or Negoroshu in the battle of Kumeda.
It is said that Miyoshi's army was waiting for the rain because Yoshitaka MIYOSHI was shot by Saikashu or Negoroshu in the battle of Kumeda.

sen.j: 三好方は勢いにまかせて大和国へ侵入し、畠山氏の与党を追討していった。
sen.e: Miyoshi's army, catching the momentum, invaded into Yamato Province to attack Hatakeyama's rump.
Miyoshi's army, catching the momentum, invaded into Yamato Province to attack Hatakeyama's rump.
Miyoshi's army, catching the momentum, invaded into Yamato Province to attack Hatakeyama's rump.

sen.j: また、六角氏も畠山氏の敗北を知って近江国へ退却し、講和を図った。
sen.e: Knowing the defeat of the Hatakeyama clan, the Rokkaku clan receded to Omi Province and tried to make peace with Miyoshi.
Knowing the defeat of the Hatakeyama clan, the Rokkaku clan receded to Omi Province and tried to make peace with Miyoshi.
Knowing the defeat of the Hatakeyama clan, the Rokkaku clan receded to Omi Province and tried to make peace with Miyoshi.

sen.j: 旧勢力の畠山氏の勢力が瓦解し、六角氏も軍門に降ったため、三好氏の勢力が大きくなった。
sen.e: The Miyoshi clan became more powerful because an old power, the Hatakeyama clan collapsed and the Rokkaku clan also gave in.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Miyoshi clan became more powerful because an old power, the Hatakeyama clan collapsed and the Rokkaku clan also gave in.
The Miyoshi clan became more powerful because an old power, the Hatakeyama clan collapsed and the Rokkaku clan also gave in.

sen.j: 畿内に三好氏に対抗する勢力はなくなり、この後、大和国、河内国が三好氏の支配下となった。
sen.e: There was no opposing powers to the Miyoshi clan in Kinai region anymore, and then Yamato Province as well as Kawachi Province became under the Miyoshi clan's control.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There was no opposing powers to the Miyoshi clan in Kinai region anymore, and then Yamato Province as well as Kawachi Province became under the Miyoshi clan's control.
There was no opposing powers to the Miyoshi clan in Kinai region anymore, and then Yamato Province as well as Kawachi Province became under the Miyoshi clan's control.

sen.j: 紀伊国の北部も三好氏の勢力が及ぶようになった。
sen.e: The Miyoshi clan became influential as far as to the northern Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Miyoshi clan became influential as far as to the northern Kii Province.
The Miyoshi clan became influential as far as to the northern Kii Province.
